definition: He who comes is surely ill-intentioned, no-one well-meaning will come (idiom)./Be careful not to trust foreigners./Beware of Greeks bearing gifts!
pinyin: lai2 zhe3 bu4 shan4 , shan4 zhe3 bu4 lai2

definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

definition: to have bad intentions
lit. easy to dodge the spear in the open, hard to avoid a stab in the dark (idiom); it is hard to guard against secret conspiracies
pinyin: ming2 qiang1 yi4 duo3 , an4 jian4 nan2 fang2

definition: variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
lit. strong dragon cannot repress a snake (idiom); fig. a local gangster who is above the law

definition: How do you catch the tiger cub without entering the tiger's lair? (idiom); Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
pinyin: bu4 ru4 hu3 xue2 , yan1 de2 hu3 zi3

definition: peaceful measures before using force (idiom); diplomacy before violence/jaw-jaw is better than war-war
to come prepared
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
cunning/crafty/wily old fox
lit. to dispatch a general is not as effective as to excite a general/fig. inciting people to action is more effective than dispatching orders
pinyin: qing3 jiang4 bu4 ru2 ji1 jiang4

definition: The honest person does nothing underhand (idiom)./fig. Do what you want to do openly and without dissimulation.
pinyin: ming2 ren2 bu4 zuo4 an4 shi4

definition: see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
a wise man knows better than to fight when the odds are against him (idiom)
